trial_identification.studytitle: Retrospective analysis of patient outcomes following surgical placement of the Swedish Adjustable Gastric Band-C (SAGB-VC) for the treatment of morbid obesity
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Retrospective analysis of weight loss following surgical placement of the Swedish Adjustable Gastric Band-C (SAGB-VC) for the treatment of morbid obesity

interventions.interventions: This is a retrospective audit of existing data in which we wish to analyse the efficacy and safety of the Swedish Adjustable Gastric Band (SAGB) in the treatment of morbid obesity over thw past 5 years. It is our intention to analyse follow-up data from those patients who have an SAGB.
interventions.comparator: There is no control group for this series of patients

primaryOutcome.outcome: Weight loss Assessed by body mass index, body mass scales

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Complications of surgery e.g. post operative infection on clinical assessment
Blood pressure measuerd using a sphygmomanometer
Fasting blood lipids and glucose measured at a certified commercial laboratory
Presence or absence of diabetes on clinical assessment
Presence or absence of hypertension on clinical assessment

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: National Health & Medical Research Council (NHMRC) criteria for surgery of body mass index (BMI) >35 kg/m2 with one or more co-morbidities or BMI greater than 40 kg/m2
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Inability to understand follow-up and operative procedures, untreated psychiatric disorders and alcohol and/or drug abuse

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Ethicon Endo-Surgery, Inc. 4545 Creek Road Cincinnati, Ohio 45242

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Ethicon Endo-Surgery, Inc. 4545 Creek Road Cincinnati, Ohio 45242

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Bariatric surgery is increasingly used as a treatment for morbid obesity. This is a retrospective audit of existing data in which we wish to analyse the efficacy and safety of the Swedish Adjustable Gastric Band (SAGB) VC in the treatment of morbid obesity. It is our intention to analyse follow-up data from those patients who have an SAGB-VC.
